br.h3: This page is dedicated to providing up-to-date information and communication regarding COVID-19 or Coronavirus. Here you will find links to government agencies, connections to resources, and all communication from CSDNB regarding this on-going situation.

p.strong: Updates and Resources from Government Agencies

br.p: Below are links to Government Agencies with up-to-date information and advice regarding COVID-19 or Coronavirus. The United Way of Connecticut also has a 2-1-1 hotline dedicated to answering general questions free of charge for individuals. Call 2-1-1 or text "CTCOVID" to 898211.

li.a: County and City Health Officials Directory of Local Health Depts
City of New Britain Health Department

strong.center: Steps for Limiting Spread of the Flu and Coronavirus

ul.li: Wash hands frequently with soap and hot water for 20 seconds
Avoid touching eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands
Avoid close contact with people who are sick
If you become sick with respiratory symptoms like fever and cough, stay home and avoid contact with other people while you are sick so you do not spread the virus to others.

April 20th, 2020: Please see today's message from Superintendent Sarra regarding grading procedure for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Click here to read the Superintendent's Message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

br.li: April 17th, 2020: Please see today's message to students from Superintendent Sarra, including a tentative timeline for the NBHS Class of 2020 Graduation. Click here to read the Superintendent's Message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

April 13th, 2020: The State Department of Education has launched a "Professional Support Series" for families in response to COVID-19. This webinar series is designed to provide support as families are the first line of defense in reassuring and talking with their children during these uncertain times. Click here to read the Superintendent's Message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

April 12th, 2020: Beginning April 13, an eighth Food Distribution Site at Jefferson Elementary School at 140 Horse Plain Road will also open. The other sites are Smalley Elementary on 175 West Street, New Britain High School at 110 Mill Street, Smith Elementary School at 142 Rutherford Road, Pulaski Middle School at 757 Farmington Avenue, Lincoln Elementary School at 145 Steele Street, Diloreto Elementary & Middle School at 732 Slater Road, and the Boys and Girls Club at 150 Washington Steet. The hours are Monday-Friday from 8:30 am -10:00 am and from 11:30 am -1:00 pm. All children ages 18 and younger can receive a free prepackaged breakfast and lunch. You may pick up both breakfast and lunch with one stop. Click here to read more and for Spanish and Arabic translation

April 9th, 2020: Please see today's message from Superintendent Sarra regarding Continued Educational Opportunities. Included are updates on the announcement by Governor Lamont and the State Department of Education that school closure has been extended until at least May 20, 2020, a reminder that on-line learning will continue daily April 13-17, and that the new electronic scholarship application is available to high school seniors. Click here to read the Superintendent's Message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

April 7th, 2020: On April 6, the Board of Education voted to work through the originally scheduled April vacation. The five days will be given back to staff and families in June with the last day of school moving up to Friday, June 12. Click here to read more about the School Calendar Update (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

April 6th, 2020: In this week's Monday Message, Superintendent Sarra shares some impressive numbers and statistics. Great work CSDNB staff and families making these "wins" possible. This week, we will work together as a community to make sure the numbers keep going up! Click Here to Watch Superintendent Sarra's "Monday Message" | Click here to read Superintendent Sarra's Shoutouts (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

April 3rd, 2020: CSDNB has prepared a list of expectations for students using Google Hangouts Meet during Continued Educational Opportunities. The list of norms is for students when video conferencing with school staff and individual students or small groups of students. Click here for Student Norms for Google Hangouts Meet (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

April 2nd, 2020: Our Pupil Services Department would like to offer our wishes for your health and continued wellbeing during this unprecedented time. CSDNB is transitioning to new ways to provide your child with continued educational opportunities during the COVID-19 crisis. We are happy to answer questions and assist as needed. Please click below for a list of contacts for our department and the schools or services they oversee. Click here for Pupil Services Directory (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

April 1st, 2020: Please see today's message from Superintendent Sarra regarding important information from the State Department of Education and the importance that everyone Stay Safe, Stay at Home as we enter into a peak period. Click here to read the Superintendent's message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

March 30th, 2020, Please see the first of Superintendent Sarra's weekly "Monday Message" series, as we begin phase two learning for our extended school closure: Continued Educational Opportunities (CEO). Click to watch the Superintendent's message

March 27th, 2020: In an effort to keep everyone connected and informed, Superintendent Nancy Sarra has released the following updates for students, families, and staff regarding Phase Two learning for our extended school closure: Continuing Educational Opportunities. Please see the message, which includes resources in accessing Google Clasroom. Click here to read the Superintendent's message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

March 26th, 2020: Superintendent Sarra has released the following updates for students, families, and staff regarding Meal Distribution Centers and State Testing Udpates from the State Department of Education. Click here to read the Superintendent's message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

March 24th, 2020: Superintendent Sarra has released the following updates for students, families, and staff regarding extended school closure. Click here to read the Superintendent's message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

March 24th, 2020: Superintendent Sarra has released the following updates for students, families, and staff regarding extended school closure. Click here to read the Superintendent's message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)
March 23rd, 2020: Superintendent Sarra has released the following updates for students, families, and staff. Click here to read the Superintendent's message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

March 20th, 2020: The following is the full message from Superintendent Nancy Sarra with several important updates that was communicated by phone to families Friday evening. Click here to read the Superintendent's message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

March 20th, 2020: Today's update from Superintendent Sarra is a reminder to ensure your contact information is up to date in PowerSchool. Letters regarding CSDNB's Interim Learning Plan, including how to access, will be mailed home in the next few days. Click here to read the Superintendent's message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

March 19th, 2020: We will be sharing regular updates from the Office of the Superintendent to ensure our community is as informed as possible during this uncertain time. Thank you all for your continued support and patience. Please see Superintendent Nancy Sarra's message. Click here to read the Superintendent's message (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

March 18th, 2020: CSDNB staff has created a possible daily schedule for families to use during school closure. The schedule is intended to be a helpful suggestion and can be flexible. Click here to see daily suggested schedule | (Printable)

March 16th, 2020: The last day of school for all CSDNB schools will be June 19, 2020. Graduation is still scheduled for Monday, June 22, 2020, and will not be pushed back. Due to changes in CDC guidance and continued policy updates from the State Department of Education, we will no longer be adding days to the end of the planned calendar year.

March 13th, 2020: Student Email Communication The school district will be also use the student email system to send additional messages to all students. Not sure how to access your email? Log in using your student google account. Click here to go to your student email Having trouble accessing between google accounts? Click here

br.p: Monday, March 30, 2020 marks the beginning of phase two of learning during the extended school closure in the Consolidated School District of New Britain. We are calling this phase Continued Educational Opportunities (CEO). During CEO, Google Classroom will be the primary vehicle for classroom instruction. Students will access assignments and tasks posted by their classroom teacher(s) through their Google Classroom(s). Questions about posted assignments should be directed to classroom teachers. In addition, on or before Monday, April 6th, a weekly overview of plans will be available on each schools page linked above under School Pages.

This DAB website will remain active and available during CEO and can be used to support and supplement student work with their teachers in Google Classroom. Families may continue to use resources on DAB as they wish.

a.span: Click here to enter the academics DAB Website

br.center:
School Offices and Family School Liaisons have temporary phone numbers and can be reached during normal school hours.
Click for Temporary Directory of Schools During School Closure
Click for Temporary Directory of Family School Liaisons During School Closure
Pupil Services continues to provide support and resources for families during school closure
Click for Pupil Services Directory (English) | (Spanish) | (Arabic)

Are you looking for internet options? The State of Connecticut offers a list of internet service providers with information on packages they are offering to increase access during the COVID-19 crisis.
See Here For Information On Internet Options

ul.li: Have WiFi but no computer at home? The DAB resources are available on any device! This includes Smart Televisions, XBoxes, and Playstations too!

a.span: See Here For On-Line Learning Technology Information

div.strong: In partnership with family and community, the Consolidated School District of New Britain works to provide the best personalized and comprehensive whole-child education at every level so students will be prepared for, and positively contribute to, a profoundly different future. The Consolidated School District of New Britain strives to pursue excellence one student a time.
